text:
CNS germ cell tumors include unusual thirst, frequent urination, early puberty, or vision changes.    - Imaging studies and tests are used to detect (find) and diagnose childhood CNS germ cell tumors.    - A biopsy may be done to be sure of the diagnosis of CNS germ cell tumor.    - Certain factors affect prognosis (chance of recovery).
                
                
                    Childhood central nervous system (CNS) germ cell tumors form from germ cells.
